too bad you ripped the complete cd as a single flac file instead of track by track.

these are ripped sequentially, not as the collection was actually presented. I have re-ripped them in their proper order, so i could burn the CDs with the proper IDs.  If you want to do so, you will need a decent wav editor. i used wavelab.

thanks though, these were timeless performances.
It be nice if it was 24 bit and 96 or 192khz so it would actually sound close to the actuall sacd. My CD's sound better than this.

Good quality. Thank You.

BUT.........

These don't seem to be real SACD. OR it has been reduced down to the quality of a normal CD.

All files are 16bit 44.1KHz. 

Normally SACD will be 24bit and 96KHz (sometimes even 196KHz). This makes a big difference to the audio.
